comment: I learned more from Professor Ray than my honors English 1101 class. If you want to improve your writing, he is the way to go.

4 papers. He explains exactly what he wants out of each. Always have paper reviewed, helps with getting better grade. Gives small readings and quizzes over. Most are easy. Never had tests. Papers are the tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor will honestly do anything to help a student. If you need help with your papers, he will sit down with you individually and help you with whatever you need. Just write to appeal to him and you'll be fine.

This guy will not answer your emails on time if his life depended on it. Another bad thing is that he puts grades at the last minute. Even though he is funny, he is a pretty strict grader on essays. Please DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is really nice, but he takes FOREVER to grade assignments. It is FINALS WEEK, and he still does not have our last 2 papers (each worth 20% of our grade) graded. I took his hybrid class. For the hybrid part, you just had to do discussion posts. We had 3 papers (20% each), homework, 3 online quizzes, and the discussions. No final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: My one gripe is that he takes forever to grade. He's really nice though and his class is pretty easy, but make sure you know what he wants out of the papers. We had weekly discussions online and 3 papers plus like 2 quizzes. It was a hybrid so we only met once a week so class was mandatory.

We only had to write 3 papers, and the final was a presentation. It was a pretty easy class, and you get a long time to write each essay. There are discussion posts, which are easy. You get to choose your own essay topics which makes the class more interesting (he doesn't mind controversial topics). Pretty easy class overall.

Professor Ray is pretty cool, my class was a hybrid so we only met once a week. He did online discussions. We had 3 essays and a final presentation. Every week he does graded check ins on your essays. He is not very responsive to emails. Only had one quiz and he doesn't check attendance.
